i received this in my host console upon shutting down my target. target was 
200401201132 + the eclipse new look branch.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Job manager has been shut down.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.schedule

Make sure you are using WorkbenchJobs for updating markers as they only run 
when there is a workbench

chris, can you get this on the latest code?  what was the failure other then 
the error in the log?

I get this execption in M8 when I was starting up a runtime workbench. What was
happening is that a NoClassDefFound in my plugin (in the constructor of one of
the  views that the workbench was trying to restore from a previous session)
caused the whole launch to fail (the splash screen stays on until I kill it from
the Task Manager) and the "Illegal state exception" error was shown in the
console. I'll attach the output from the .log file separately (note that it only
shows the NPE, I only figured out it was an NCDF when I moved the code around --
let me know if this is something that should be filed as a bug separately), but
this is what was shown in the console:

Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:

Created an attachment (id=8997)
Log file with the UPE

The associated log file. Actually, it does contain the NoClassDefFound, only
higher up and with a really long stack dump, so I didn't notice that it
happened in the same session with the UPE and the Job manager message.

The original bug reported by Chris is fixed in head. The error message in his
log file was the only problem here, since it is valid for the job to be shut
down at this point. The correct behavior is to skip the UI job, which was
happening anyway. I've added a check to suppress the error message from the log.

I believe comment 3 is an unrelated bug, possibly related to (but not a
duplicate of) bug 58279. They both appear to be situations where an exception
during view initialization was not handled correctly, resulting in an invalid
workbench state.

This portion of the error log seems to be related to the ProgressManager. Adding
Tod for comment.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Job manager has been shut down.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.schedule(JobManager.java:623)

This is a bug in the ErrorNotificationManager. I'll take this one.
